byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Niraj Chokshi, Stephanie Saul, Thomas Kaplan and Ashley Parker.

abstract: Khizr Khan, whose son Capt Humayun Khan was killed in combat in Iraq in June 2004, takes stage at Democratic National Convention to speak for Muslim Americans outraged by Republican anti-Muslim rhetoric; Khan criticizes Donald Trump's pledge to bar Muslims like himself and his son from United States, becoming media star overnight.
lead_paragraph: In a speech that included displaying a copy of the Constitution, a father rebuked Donald J. Trump and gave voice to Muslim Americans.

headline.main: In Tribute to Son, Khizr Khan Offered Citizenship Lesson at Convention
headline.print_headline: In Tribute to Dead Son, a Lesson in Citizenship

snippet: In a speech that included displaying a copy of the Constitution, a father rebuked Donald J. Trump and gave voice to Muslim Americans....
